concept.title: Naming tasks
concept.shortdesc: Task names are named based on the filename of the task, the name of the module, and the path to the task within the module.

p.draft-comment: Shared between Bolt and PE 2018.1+, except as noted

conbody.p: You can write tasks in any language that runs on the target nodes. Give task files the extension for the language they are written in (such as .rb for Ruby), and place them in the top level of your module's ./tasks directory.
Task names are composed of one or two name segments, indicating:

li.p: The name of the module where the task is located.
The name of the task file, without the extension.

conbody.p: For example, the puppetlabs-mysql module has the sql task in ./mysql/tasks/sql.rb, so the task name is mysql::sql. This name is how you refer to the task when you run tasks.
The task filename init is special: the task it defines is referenced using the module name only. For example, in the puppetlabs-service module, the task defined in init.rb is the service task.

p.draft-comment: Paragraph removed in 2019.0.0, when sections below were added. <Task names must be unique. If there are two tasks with the same name but different file extensions in a module, the task runner won't load either of them.>

conbody.p: Each task or plan name segment must begin with a lowercase letter and:

li.p: Must start with a lowercase letter.
Namespace segments must match the following regular expression \A[a-z][a-z0-9_]*\Z

ul.li: The file extension must not use the reserved extensions .md or .json.
